event: Earliest human presence in present-day Guyana
Indigenous Arawak and Carib societies develop river-based settlements
Indigenous trade networks connect the Guianas and Amazon basin
European explorers sight the Guyana coast
Dutch establish early trading posts and settlements
Dutch plantation economy expands along coastal rivers
Britain gains control of the colony from the Dutch
Slavery is abolished, followed by indentured labor immigration
Arbitration settles border dispute with Venezuela
Self-government movement intensifies under British rule
Guyana gains independence from the United Kingdom
